definition: (coll.) to cause trouble for sb/to inconvenience
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: Jack warns him not to obscure the mission.
sentences.chinese: 杰克警告他不要给这次行动添乱。

sentences.english: Many politicians say a general election would only add to the chaos.
sentences.chinese: 许多政治家认为举行大选只会添乱。

sentences.english: Mr Martinelli, a supermarket magnate, is not helping.
sentences.chinese: 超市大亨马蒂内利先生对此不帮忙还反添乱。

sentences.english: All night he’d been giving me grief.
sentences.chinese: 整个晚上他一直在给我添乱。

definition: to create difficulties/to invite trouble/to be troublesome
to cause trouble for sb/to inconvenience
to be more of a hindrance than a help
to make people feel even more stressed or annoyed (coll.)/to make traffic congestion even worse
to look for employment/to pick a quarrel
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
to make a scene/to fool around/to behave foolishly
to ask for trouble/to bring misfortune on oneself
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to make a mess of sth
to make an exhibition of oneself/to be a disgrace
to be a drag or hindrance on sb
to be officious/to kibitz/to be meddlesome/to force one's help upon
to stir up trouble/to get into trouble
